intro: Cyphostemma kaniamae, commonly known as the Kaniama cactus, is a unique plant native to parts of Central Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and spiny foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Cyphostemma kaniamae is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in dry woodlands.
